headline: Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies
description: These chocolate chip oatmeal cookies are quick and easy to make and have the best texture - crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside.

video.description: Whoever said oatmeal cookies are boring has clearly never tried this recipe. Once anyone tries these chocolate- and nut-packed oatmeal cookies, they won't have another bad word to say. These oatmeal chocolate chip cookies rock!
video.name: How to Make Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies

name: Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl. Set aside.
Cream together butter, brown sugar, and white sugar in a large bowl until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time, until well combined; stir in vanilla extract.
Stir flour mixture into egg mixture until just blended. Mix in quick oats, walnuts, and chocolate chips. Drop batter by heaping spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12 minutes. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: Found these cookies delicious! I did use half the amount of salt recommended but thats because I used salted butter.

Great recipe and my cookies turned out great. I followed some of the advice here (used half the salt, chilled the dough for about ten minutes in the fridge, and upped the cooking time to about 14 minutes). I used Ghiradelli milk chocolate chips because I prefer them over the bittersweet chocolate and I left out the nuts. I also used old fashioned organic oats. They were not "quick oats" but they were all I had on hand and they worked out just fine (maybe that's why my cookies needed more time?). All in all a good recipe and I'll definitely make them again.

These are SOOOO good! My son and husband agree. My son said there are amazing. The only recommendation that I have is to put the dough in the fridge for a few hours or overnight, otherwise they will melt quickly and become flat. Delicious!!!
First time baking oatmeal cookies. Didn't add the nuts. Everyone loved them. Baked them for 11 minutes. My new favorite cookie recipe.
I make this cookie every year for our Christmas cookie exchange 16 dozen to be exact and they are a winner every year .

I followed the recipe and had no issues with spreading. Spreading happens when flour isn't measured properly. I did find them too salty and would definitely cut that in half. Overall they were alright.
My cookies took longer to bake about 15 minutes

Great recipe, I took it a bit further and made Kitsilano Cookies by adding shelled pumpkin and sunflower seed, swapped the walnuts for pecans as well. Before adding the oatmeal, stir in the nuts and chocolate chips, then add oatmeal 1 1/12 cups at a time. Makes it easier to stir. Increase baking time to 15 minutes. Enjoy!

Followed the recipe exactly !! And they were soft, chewy and not too sweet!! I love these because these induces my lactation for our baby ! Oats increase lactation, I added in some brewers yeasts too as an extra boost for my lactation and wow these are so good, my pregnant friends love them and then got there milk in!!! So even better !! Love these and I can't bake these fast enough for myself and our 6 pregnant friends !!

This recipe is perfect the way it is. They remind of a certain cookie that I thought I'd only find at a bakery. Because I LOVE oatmeal, I will add anywhere from a 1/2 cup to 1 cup extra oatmeal and they still stay chewy.
My family loves these. The only reason that it’s not 5 is because they do not last long 😂 If I can bake these I assure you anyone can

There is something very, very wrong with this recipe. As it is, it's a complete waste of ingredients. Even after chilling the dough for 6 hours, the "cookies" turned into puddles once in the oven. I suspect one of the causes may be the recipe's call for baking soda rather than baking powder and perhaps insufficient flour.
Love this recipe AS IS. 3rd time making them and the family gobbles them up every time. Great cookies. Thank you!! A++++

Can't give 5 stars - made a few changes (1 inadvertently). Totally missed the white sugar (taste just fine without it), added 1/2 cup extra flour, added 1/2 tsp extra baking soda and used a little less than 1 tsp of salt. My cookies did not spread at all - not even a little. My husband asked me if could make them flatter! Good flavor. Will try adding cinnamon next time.
I followed the directions exactly and they turned out AWESOME! Note that they don't spread out a lot on the cookie sheet so you don't need to space them out too far.
The overall cookie was good but it was a little salty, and there were not a lot of chocolate chips included.

Great, chewy cookies. I made them with ingredients I had and substituted chocolate chips and walnuts with white chocolate chips, chopped cashews and chopped dried apricots. Yum!! I also used half coconut oil and half butter.
Followed the most popular review's suggestions. Pretty good. I added 1/2 tsp of cinnamon. Should have added a full tsp. It's hard to give these cookies oomph.
Cookies did not rise. They spread completely. Very molasses in flavor. Too much brown sugar. More like a tuile.
I have made this many times and the clients where I work just love them. Sometimes I add raisins or dried cranberries
The cookies were flat and not as thick as I expected. They were great tasting though. Not sure what changes can be made to make them thicker.
Awesome. I tweaked it Over the years. Double the salt and double the chips. Makes one heck of a difference. Also one cup of milk chocolate chips and one cup of dark.
Loved the recipe!!! Made a couple of changes changes: used old fashioned oatmeal and half regular sugar other half with Splenda. My husband said they were the best!!!

I followed the recipe exactly (minus the nuts) and then I looked at others reviews since my cookies came out very flat but tasty. I guess it's a matter of preference on how you like your cookies. Sometimes I like the flatter crispy outside ones and sometimes I like the denser taller ones. These were very buttery and crispy on the outside. I might make some adjustments based on other reviews next time.
Awful. Wasted ingredients. Totally flattened out even after I chilled them.

When I was making these cookies I was reading the reviews and saw that a lot of people who followed the recipe got flat cookies. (Im 14 btw and bake a lot but i don't usually modify recipes) I was worried that my cookies would come out flat too, so I added a 1/4 cup of more flour and baked them and they turned out great! I used a 2 tablespoon cookie scooper and I let them sit on the cooking sheet for 5 minutes, then transferred them to a cooling rack. I'm not sure why other people's cookies turned out flat, but mine turned out great!

I made these cookies using the exact recipe as written with three modifications: set the oven to 350 instead of 325, used old-fashioned oats instead of quick cooking oats, and chilled the dough for about 15 minutes prior to baking. They came out perfectly! Chewy with slightly crispy edges. I also kept the dough chilling in the fridge between batches. i made them relatively large - only 9 cookies to a sheet. Result was 4 dozen cookies.
Horrible cookies! I followed the directions exactly. They are bland and boring. The majority of the 5 star reviews are the ones that modified the recipe!

they turned out pretty good! I changed the recipe a lot- added an extra 1/4 cup flour, instead of brown sugar I used 1/2 agave syrup and 1/2 maple syrup, and added chopped dates instead of chocolate chips and walnuts. and I used normal oats instead of quick-cooking oats. they melted together in the pan but it was no big deal. might half the recipe next time. good chewy texture, my fiancé liked them a lot!

Yummy… however some modifications were needed. If you’re an experienced baker you will frel thd need to add flour as I did … not dure if it was 1/2 a cup but more is required. Second the cooking temperature I found should be 350F not 325. With the modification … yes very yummy! I prefer pecans myself as well.
Taste good but turned into a puddle. I followed the recipe too.

Followed instructions exactly, had no problems at all . I used my small cookie scoop slightly round , I ended up with 56 nice sized cookies Tasted excellent This will be my go to Chewy chocolate chip oatmeal cookies . Thank you, great job.

This recipe was so fun to make! Felt like I was a kid again in my kitchen baking with my mom. They turned out perfect, I skipped the nuts and the texture is perfect! The batch made a lot of cookies and I ended up giving some to the neighbors... THEY LOVED THEM.

I love these. I learned about keeping them on the pan for 5 minutes to add some “chewiness” That helped greatly. I substituted butterscotch for chocolate and cashews for walnuts. Still very happy with them. I halved the recipe and it made 48.

There has to be a typo in this recipe. 1 Cup of Butter must be one stick. I've never seen such glossy dough. So sticky. They had no loft and they took twice as long to cook. And, they are crispy, not chewy.

Delicious cookies! The perfect combination of oatmeal cookies and chocolate chip cookies! I was able to make about 40 cookies with this recipe. The one thing I found different was the stickiness of the dough, BUT it didn’t make a difference with the cooking. Super delicious!

I *LOVED* this recipe!! I was craving a yummy oatmeal desert and this was perfect! I did make subtle changes though. Instead of the walnuts and chocolate chips, I went for a more classic oatmeal-raisin cookie. The flavor was spot-on though. Would highly recommend making these! Yum! And yes, I am eating this cookie as I write.
This recipe is wonderful, because apart from working really well in the texture, it tastes delicious!!
Likeit,I added granular

I remember making these for my grandma, I added 2 extra eggs and i think i accidentally added 3 more cups of flour, cant remember what else but it was strong oatmeal, and my grandma loved them, unfortunately she has passed but I'm definitely making them again for this next road trip. 10/10

I’ve made this recipe several times a year for the past like… 12 years or so. My friends request this regularly, and I make them whenever they’re going through a hard time. My advice? MAKE THEM INTO BARS! Put the entire batch into a parchment-lined baking pan or sheet (depending how thick or thin you want them) and smooth them out (spray your hands or instrument with PAM because the batter is sticky!), bake at the same temperature for about 30 minutes, and voila, delicious oatmeal chocolate chip bars! They’re a LOT better than trying to just make the cookies, which spread into a weird pancake.
The Best! Made with chocolate chips & no raisins or walnuts. Yippee!
They took much longer than 12 minutes to bake, I think it took closer to 18. I also used pecans. Not a keeper.
i made a double batch and they turned out so well!!! add extra vanilla :)

Delicious, chewy cookies. I followed some of the suggestions (1 1/2 cups flour, 1 t. baking soda and 1/2 t. salt) and substituted dried cherries for the walnuts (our family doesn't like nuts in cookies). Everyone loved them!
Great cookies. We were a bit short of chocolate chips but they were still good. Had to cook for about another minute.

I tweaked the recipe a bit. 1. Skipped the white sugar, added tiny bit of maple syrup 2. Added one table spoon of high quality Cocoa powder 3. Added one table spoon of dry milk powder 4. Added golden raisins 5. Substituted 50% white flour with 50% almond flour 6. Added a small dash of cinnamon and nutmeg powder 7. Added little bit of psyllium husk. It was an instant hit 🎯
This is a good recipe!! I love it!!
Added 1/2 tsp soda and 1/2 c flour
Very dry
These cookies are everything I hope for with chocolate chip oatmeal cookies! My husband and my neighbor are happy I baked them also
I didn't add walnuts and I used mini m&ms.
Recipe was not the best. The cookies ended up just being one big cookie. Won’t be making again.
Always a hit. Wife gets one in her lunch everyday for work.
The cookies where superb, we where jumping for more when we where done! However, they did need to be baked for an extra two to three minutes.

The cookies spread out paper thin. I have a strong suspicion when they completely cool, they’ll be hard as rocks. As others have said, they need more flour. Wish I had read the comments before I made these. I would’ve just used the Quaker recipe.
If you're using salted butter, only put half the salt in or even less. Other than that, I LOVE these cookies and so does everyone I've made them for 😀
Was a great hit it was yummy

Fantastic recipe. On occasion, I add an extra egg yolk for chewier cookies (and soften the butter to almost melted), but they turn out great either way. I use a fork to smoosh ours down before baking (I like flat cookies), so a final suggestion for anyone interested in the same.
I made the recipe exactly as given in the recipe. COOKIES were DELICIOUS!!! My husband loved them. Thank you for sharing =)
Excellent taste! These cookies also bake into a nice, uniform cookie. They lean a little bit to the salty side, but we like them that way! Great recipe!
Took longer than 12 mins to bake, I did make larger dough balls though. SO SO good!! Wouldn’t change a thing.
Too much butter or too little flour?? Thin and messy - after baking the first batch I added tons of oats and flour to thicken.
Best cookie ever. It's the only kind I bake now. My husband loves them too. They come out better when I chill the dough overnight. We love them. I always put walnuts in them.
They were pretty good but I had to bake them at 350 degrees Fahrenheit instead of 325 degrees Fahrenheit. I also had to broil the cookies for another three minutes so they were not what’s at the top
Followed recipe and they are delicious.
Cookie flat. Taste average at best. Very disappointing.
Made these with my Granddaughters and they came out delicious. Made enough to last about 2 weeks and my Granddaughter was able to take in as a healthy snack for snack time.
I made these cookies with gluten free flour and they still turned out good! 👍 (I used Robin Hood gluten free flour)

Delicious recipe. But not perfect! I followed other reviewers by adding 1/4 more flour and 1/2 teaspoon more of baking soda! I found the cookies a bit too salty for my liking - so 1/2 teaspoon of salt is highly recommended. And less chocolate chips because cookies were a bit too sweet.

Made an account just to say how atrocious this recipe is. The cookies taste delicious. But there is too much butter in the recipe that makes the cookies spread out really thin. They got stuck to the ungreased cookie sheet even though there is plenty of butter and the recipe says that you don’t need to. Luckily I used a silpat on a couple of them. Definitely won’t be repeating in the future.

This was quite a good recipe...I only did one sub and that was to use "Just Egg" in place of the egg - about 3 1/2 tbs. I maybe should have refrigerated them for a bit after mixing since they spread a bit but tasted great. I made half a recipe and perhaps because of the difference in proportions the 1/2 tsp. of salt was a bit much. I'll be making this again because I don't like raisins but I love the walnuts!
My cookies were a huge hit! I used 2 smashed bananas to replace eggs, almond flour > all purpose, and dates to replace sugar (I wanted them to be healthier).
I made these for my family and we all enjoyed it. The only things I did different were add 1/2 cup more of flour because a lot of people were suggesting that and I put raisins instead of walnuts.
Tastes amazing! Perfect texture!

These cookies looked amazing, however, my batter was SO dry! I followed the recipe to a tee but when it came time to fold in the oats, nuts and chocolate chips, I couldn't get them to mix in with the batter at all. They all just fell to the bottom of the bowl. I had to form cookie "meatballs", trying to get the ingredients to stick together and even then, they were crumbling before even going into the oven- what could I be doing wrong??? My butter was mostly melted- could that be the issue?
Very good! A family favorite now.
good cookies not as chewy as we would have liked.
I cooked them at 375 for 13 minutes and they came out perfect! I'll keep this recipe to make more

This has moved up to our new favorite cookie. Giving it four stars for the posted recipe. Easily 5 stars with the suggested changes of extra 1/2 cup flour, extra 1/2 tsp baking powder, and half the salt. Cookies are slightly mounded, chewy, with a beautiful crisp edge.

Good recipe, but I only put in 1 1/2 sticks of butter in it because I had already used the other half in a different recipe. I forgot to add an additional half!!! And of course I didn’t figure this out until I finished baking started to do the review.
 I wondered why mine didn’t spread out at all! They still taste good, they’re just not chewy like I wanted and they look like molehills lol. I used an ice cream scoop so they would all be the same size.
I made the last batch a bit smaller because they were very large and took more like 14 minutes

Nice simple recipe! I was glad because I already had everything in my house. I noticed the first batch came out flat so I chilled the second batch for 20-30 minutes and they came out perfect! I also recommended using salted butter instead of salt.
best cookies ever. added extra 1/4 cup flour, halved the salt, doubled the baking soda. 12 minutes in oven. perfect cookies.. really good

Used dried cranberries instead of chocolate chips and were so good! 

Also made without walnuts or chocolate and good!
I'm using rolled Oat and put chocolate chip into middle. It's so great my son and his grandma love it.
This recipe was pretty good, but i wondered at times if certain ingredients were too much like the oatmeal there was a lot of oatmeal. Overall very good.

I love this recipe! These cookies are definitely my favorite! I 100% recommend them! The only only thing is that I have to put them in the oven longer than the recipe said. But I do make them bigger than called for.

Unfortunately as is they are wafer thin and oily. I even added the extra 1/2 tsp baking Soda , 1/4c flour and reduced salt to 1/2 tsp and didn’t over mix as recommended and they still fell FLAT!
Second and third batches came out much better. I added another 1/3c flour and they finally looked like a normal cookie. Tasty after that!
Great cookies if you follow directions. My friends rave about these cookies.
Soooo good! Substituted 1/w2 of choc chips with butterscotch & just right!
Sloppy mess.
Delicious
Simple and easy. Added pecans its awesome

We made these cookies last year and I made notes that they were awesome. So we went to do it again this year and accidentally put half the correct amount of butter in. But amazingly, they were awesome! We rolled them into 1.5 inch balls and put them in the fridge for a bit. They baked perfectly, though we ended up adding 2 minutes based on results. We also put in half as much salt (on purpose :-), added a touch of cinnamon (maybe 1.8 teaspoon), and put a pinch of kosher salt on top before baking. So we'd highly recommend these either with all the butter or the low-fat version, which is what we're going to use from now on.

Didn't spread and stayed nice and thick! Turned out perfect with changes suggested by other reviewers. 

I added an extra 1/2 cup flour, whole tsp of baking soda and a 1/2 tsp of salt. 

I creamed my butter and sugars for 4 minutes (set a timer, it's longer than you think!) until it was super fluffy, premixed the dry ingredients then stirred until it was just incorporated.

I used a 1/4 cup scoop and baked at 335 for 12 mintues. No need to chill, they didn't spread at all! Keep in mind, it's cold where I live. If I made these in the summer, I may need to chill first.
I made a double batch for a church event and they turned out perfect! I did add more flour as suggested by other reviewers.
They came out perfect! So chewy and delicious! I'll be saving this recipe for sure!
My "Go To" recipe. Makes a nice surprise for my kids and husband; they LOVE these cookies and these always put a smile on their faces.
